00016 #include "stdio.h"
00017 #include "stdlib.h"
00018 #include "math.h"
00019 #include "utility.h"
00020 
00021 #define N_STEPS_RENORMALIZATION 20
00022 
00023 /*!*****************************************************************************
00024  *******************************************************************************
00025 \note  liapunov_exp.c
00026 \date  April, 1993
00027 
00028 \remarks 
00029 
00030         Calculates the Liapunov exponents for a given trajectory of a
00031         given dynamic system
00032 
00033  *******************************************************************************
00034  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00035 
00036  \param[in]     n_dim     : number of dimensions of the system (i.e., state space
00037                      variables)
00038  \param[in]     n_iter    : number of iterations for determining the exponents
00039  \param[in]     func      : function which takes an inital state and return the
00040                      the outcoming state and the Jacobian of it. 
00041  \param[in]     state     : the inital state at which the program shall start
00042                      running
00043  \param[in]     tau       : the time interval between two subsequent steps of
00044                      evaluation by function (for maps, set to tau=1)
00045  \param[out]    exponents : a vector of 
00046 
00047 
00048       note: program returns TRUE or FALSE, depending whether things 
00049             worked out or an error occured.
00050       note: the program obeys numerical recipies conventions, except that
00051             I always use double precision instead of foat.
00052 
00053  ******************************************************************************/
00054 int
00055 liapunov_exp(int n_dim, int n_iter, void (*func)(), double *state, 
00056              double tau, double *exponents)
00057 {
00058 
00059   double     count = 0.0;
00060   double    *x_n;        /* the state as local variable */
00061   double   **j;          /* the jacobian matrix */
00062   double    *x_n1;       /* the next state */
00063   double   **w;          /* the volume in space whose deformation will
00064                             be tracked in time to determine the
00065                             Liapunov exponents */
00066   double   **wn;         /* the volume in space after n iterations */
00067   double    *d;          /* the norm of each vector of w */
00068 
00069   int        i,n,m;
00070   double     aux;
00071   double    *temp;
00072   double     time;
00073 
00074 
00075 
00076   /* get the vectors and matrices which are needed */
00077 
00078   x_n       = my_vector(1,n_dim);
00079   x_n1      = my_vector(1,n_dim);
00080   d         = my_vector(1,n_dim);
00081   temp      = my_vector(1,n_dim);
00082   j         = my_matrix(1,n_dim,1,n_dim);
00083   w         = my_matrix(1,n_dim,1,n_dim);
00084   wn        = my_matrix(1,n_dim,1,n_dim);
00085 
00086 
00087   /* initalize these variables */
00088 
00089   for (i=1; i<=n_dim; ++i) {
00090     for (n=1; n<=n_dim; ++n) {
00091       w[i][n] = 0.0;
00092       if (i == n) w[i][n] = 1.0;
00093     }
00094   }
00095 
00096   for (i=1; i<=n_dim; ++i) {
00097     x_n[i] = state[i];
00098     d[i]   = 0.0;
00099   }
00100 
00101   mat_equal(w,wn);
00102   
00103   
00104 
00105   /* now do several iterations over the system and track the volume in time */
00106 
00107   for (i=1; i<=n_iter; ++i) {
00108 
00109     count += 1;
00110     time = count * tau;
00111     (*func)(x_n, time, j, x_n1);
00112     
00113     /* the first distortion of the volume is then given by; */
00114     
00115     mat_mult(j,wn,wn);
00116     
00117     if (count == N_STEPS_RENORMALIZATION || i == n_iter) {
00118       
00119       /* renormalize the volume by Gram-Schmidt procedure, and keep
00120          track of the expansion so far */
00121 
00122       mat_trans(wn,wn);
00123         
00124       for (n=1; n<=n_dim; ++n) {
00125       
00126         vec_equal(wn[n], w[n]);
00127         
00128         for (m=1; m<=n-1; ++m) {
00129         
00130           /* this is the Gram-Schmidt step */
00131         
00132           aux = vec_mult_inner(w[m],wn[n]);
00133         
00134           vec_mult_scalar(w[m],aux,temp);
00135         
00136           vec_sub(w[n],temp,w[n]);
00137         
00138         }
00139         
00140         aux = vec_mult_inner(w[n],w[n]);
00141                 
00142         aux = sqrt(aux);
00143                 
00144         vec_mult_scalar(w[n],1./aux,w[n]);
00145                 
00146         d[n] += log(aux);
00147                 
00148       }
00149 
00150       count = 0;
00151       
00152       mat_equal(w,wn);
00153 
00154       mat_trans(wn,wn);
00155 
00156       /*
00157         for (n=1;n<=n_dim;++n) {
00158         for (m=1;m<=n_dim; ++m) {
00159         printf("%f ",wn[n][m]);
00160         }
00161         printf("\n");
00162         }
00163         */
00164     }
00165     
00166     vec_equal(x_n1,x_n);
00167   
00168   }
00169 
00170   
00171 
00172   /* calculate the Liapunov expontents */
00173 
00174   for (i=1; i<=n_dim; ++i) {
00175 
00176     exponents[i] = d[i] / ((double)n_iter * tau);
00177 
00178   }
00179   
00180   /* free the vectors and matrices */
00181 
00182   my_free_vector(x_n,1,n_dim);
00183   my_free_vector(x_n1,1,n_dim);
00184   my_free_vector(d,1,n_dim);
00185   my_free_vector(temp,1,n_dim);
00186   my_free_matrix(j,1,n_dim,1,n_dim);
00187   my_free_matrix(w,1,n_dim,1,n_dim);
00188   my_free_matrix(wn,1,n_dim,1,n_dim);
00189 
00190   return TRUE;
00191 
00192 }
